articles.author: Jack Kim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: North Korea and Russia agreed to provide immediate military assistance if the other side faced armed aggression, under a pact their leaders signed during Russian President Vladimir Putin's first visit in 24 years.
articles.title: North Korea, Russia sign pact to give all available military help if other is attacked

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks backed by warplanes and drones advanced deeper into the western part of the Gaza Strip city of Rafah on Wednesday, killing eight people, according to residents and Palestinian medics.
articles.title: Israeli tanks push deeper into Rafah, forcing people to flee again

articles.author: Catarina Demony
articles.description: Ukrainians who fled their homes to escape Russia's invasion have received better treatment than those displaced by other ongoing wars and emergencies, Europe's top human rights group said on Thursday, calling on member states to support all equally.
articles.title: Ukrainians better treated than others displaced by war, Council of Europe says

articles.author: Kristina Cooke, Ted Hesson
articles.description: When news broke of U.S. President Joe Biden’s plan to provide a path to citizenship for certain immigrants who entered the country illegally and are married to U.S. citizens, Pennsylvania-based immigration lawyer Bridget Cambria didn’t need long to think of clients it could help.
articles.title: Biden policy is welcome relief for Americans with spouses in the country illegally

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Armenia and Azerbaijan, trying to work towards a peace treaty after three decades of conflict, traded fresh barbs on Wednesday after France pledged to supply new arms to Yerevan.
articles.title: Armenia, Azerbaijan trade barbs after France pledges new arms to Yerevan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. military's on-again, off-again floating pier in Gaza is expected to resume operations on Thursday to unload sorely needed humanitarian aid for Palestinians, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: U.S. military's stop-start Gaza pier to resume operations, officials say

articles.author: Maria Martinez
articles.description: Germany's economy minister touches down in South Korea on Thursday in the first leg of a trip to Asia, seeking to deepen ties with the region's fourth-largest economy as Berlin aims to "de-risk" its trade exposure to China.
articles.title: Germany sees a like-minded trade ally in South Korea

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Josh Smith
articles.description: Vladimir Putin, on his first visit to North Korea in 24 years, signed a mutual defence pledge with Kim Jong Un on Wednesday, underscoring just how far Russia has recast its relations with the only country to test a nuclear weapon this century.
articles.title: With defence pledge, Putin makes shift towards North Korea

articles.author: Jennifer Rigby
articles.description: The global vaccine organisation Gavi is likely to seek around $11.9 billion from governments and foundations on Thursday to fund immunisation efforts in the world’s poorest countries over five years, board documents reviewed by Reuters showed.
articles.title: Vaccine group Gavi seeks $11.9 billion to immunize world's poorest children

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korea's state media on Thursday unveiled the full text of a mutual defence pact signed a day ago by its leader Kim Jong Un and Russian President Vladimir Putin, which Kim said would elevate bilateral ties to something akin to an "alliance".
articles.title: Key points of North Korea, Russia landmark strategic partnership treaty
